outcome_details: The court determined that the estate trustees were entitled to 3% of the estate's value as compensation, totaling $52,000.00, and Anne Marie Louise Perlini was entitled to a management fee of $10,000.00 for her services under the power of attorney.
decision_factors: Financial decisions made by the estate trustees
cited_cases: Poitras v. Canadian Cancer Society, 2021 ONSC 406
Re Toronto General Trusts and Central Ontario Railway (1905) 6 O.W.R. 350 (H.C.)
Laing Estate v. Hines, 41 O.R. 571 (Ont. C.A.)
summary: The court ruled on the compensation for estate trustees and a management fee for Anne Marie Louise Perlini, determining that the amounts claimed were excessive and unreasonable. The court awarded 3% of the estate's value as compensation to the estate trustees and a total of $10,000.00 to Anne Marie Louise Perlini for her management services. The court also ordered that the costs of the parties be payable out of the estate, with specific amounts awarded to each party.
